etymologies: mid 19th century: from French collagène, from Greek kolla ‘glue’ + French -gène (see -gen)

definitions: the main structural protein found in skin and other connective tissues, widely used in purified form for cosmetic surgical treatments

examples.text: vitamin C plays a vital role in the formation of collagen
she was given a collagen injection to smooth out wrinkles in her forehead

shortDefinitions: main structural protein found in skin and other connective tissue
